title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A1, the response must describe the judicial power exercised by the court in the Shelby County v. Holder case.

For Task A2, the response must explain why this power gives the Supreme Court the authority to take the action described.

For Task B, the response must explain how the Supreme Court’s decision in Shelby County v. Holder illustrates the concept of federalism.

For Task C1, the response must describe an action Congress could take as a result of John Lewis’ statement.

For Task C2, the response must explain how it could affect the decision in Shelby County v. Holder.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any four of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any five of the tasks set by the question.
